description: {"blocks":[{"key":"75lqf","text":"Epifluorescence microscopy (EFM) has been the gold standard method for environmental viral enumeration for over 25 years. Currently, standard EFM methods using the Anodisc filters are no longer cost-effective (\u003e$15 per slide). We present a cost-effective method for environmental viral enumeration from aquatic samples, microbial mats, and exopolymeric substances (EPSs) within modern microbialites using EFM. Our integrated approach, which includes filtration, differential centrifugation, chloroform treatment, glutaraldehyde fixation, benzonase nuclease treatment, probe sonication (EPS and mat only), SYBR Gold staining, wet mounting, and imaging, provides a robust method for modern microbialites and aquatic samples. Our method provides a robust and cost-effective (~$0.75 per sample) viral enumeration within modern microbialites and aquatic ecosystems.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"73dfu","text":"This method is used to enumerate viruses in EPS samples collected from the environment. See our protocols for water viral enumeration, microbial mat viral enumeration, and soil viral enumeration!","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
keywords: EFM, epifluorescence microscopy, viral enumeration, microbialite, enumeration, phage

{"blocks":[{"key":"3d8tc","text":"OPTIONAL: Flash freeze samples using liquid nitrogen. If liquid nitrogen is not available, putting samples directly in a -80ºC freezer can be done. Samples can be stored in the -80ºC freezer until use.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5401j","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"d52f9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"alu7p","text":"This is an optional stopping point. Freezing is not necessary and may cause a decrease in viral counts. If you do not have time to proceed to dyeing and imaging, freeze your samples until use.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bee2e","text":"Add   SYBR Gold working stock to the sample in the dark and pipette to mix.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7h0vt","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"87g5e","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"4","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7hb6n","text":"The stain is light sensitive so the following steps should be done in the dark. Before preparing working stock, be sure to check if there is already some prepared. Working stocks may be stored in the -20ºC freezer or one working stock at a time may be stored in the 4ºC fridge.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":1,"offset":25}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"3aora","text":"Thaw commercial stock of   at room temperature in the dark.","type":"ordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"cpra7","text":"Once the commercial stock is thawed, vortex for 10 seconds on medium-high speed, then centrifuge in a microcentrifuge for 5 minutes.","type":"ordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"d6lvp","text":"Dilute the commercial stock 1:10 with autoclaved and filtered (0.22 μm PVDF membrane filters) molecular biology grade water in a fresh 5 mL Eppendorf tube.","type":"ordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"574ip","text":"Filter the working stock through a 0.22 μm syringe filter into a fresh 5 mL Eppendorf tube.","type":"ordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"fofce","text":"Aliquot 250 μL of the working stock into fresh black or darkened 1.5 mL low protein binding nuclease free microcentrifuge tubes.","type":"ordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"8qid2","text":"Store the working stocks at -20ºC.","type":"ordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"djbb1","text":"Working stock that is being used should be stored at 4ºC in the dark. It can work effectively for about a month, but will degrade over time (take note of when working stock is moved to 4ºC).","type":"ordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"1l2ef","text":"Working stock at -20ºC can be stored indefinitely and transferred to 4ºC when ready to use. Avoid freezing and thawing multiple times.","type":"ordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"bu49m","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{"0":{"data":{"can_edit":false,"cas_number":"","guid":"41042AD6341F11EE9D4302C0B41BC903","linfor":"","mol_weight":0,"name":"SYBR Gold Nucleic Acid Gel Stain","pubchem_id":"0","public":1,"rrid":"","sku":" S-11494 ","stats":{"total_protocols":7},"url":"https://www.lifetechnologies.com/order/catalog/product/S11494","vendor":{"id":0,"image":{"placeholder":null,"source":"/img/vendors/1.png"},"is_requested":false,"link":"https://www.protocols.io","name":"Contributed by users"}},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"reagents"}}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4gg8k","text":"Incubate the sample in a heat block covered in aluminum foil at   for  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":64,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":70,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"80","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":900,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dge7m","text":"While the sample is incubating, prepare a 10% ascorbic acid antifade solution.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ar27j","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ctvmk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"cbe5c","text":"Ascorbic acid antifade needs to be prepared fresh each time, so only prepare a small amount\nas needed. ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"bgnn2","text":"Add 1 mL 1X PBS to a fresh 1.5 mL low protein binding nuclease free microcentrifuge tube.","type":"ordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"4p4um","text":"Add 0.1 g ascorbic acid to the tube.","type":"ordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"fqlbs","text":"Mix thoroughly by vortexing until the ascorbic acid has dissolved completely.","type":"ordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"pv58","text":"Filter the mixture twice through 0.22 μm syringe filters.","type":"ordered-list-item"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"496f6","text":"Remove the sample from the heat block and add   of ascorbic acid antifade solution. Pipette to mix.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":46,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"2","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"41vv8","text":"Pipette   onto a clean, labeled, poly-L-lysine treated slide.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":8,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"a0pfh","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"a463n","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"5","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"936rd","text":"Thoroughly clean slides with 70% ethanol and allow slides to dry completely. ","type":"ordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"6nsem","text":"Prepare a 10% polylysine solution by diluting Poly-L-Lysine 0.01% w/v 1:10 in autoclaved Nanopure water (18.2 MΩ) (using plastic pipette tips and a plastic container).","type":"ordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7lhal","text":"Soak slides in the polylysine solution in a plastic container for 5 minutes (increasing time will not improve performance). Ensure there are no air bubbles on the slides.","type":"ordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"c2uhv","text":"Dry slides in a drying oven at 60ºC for one hour or overnight at room temperature. ","type":"ordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"2qfrc","text":"Once dried, slides can be stored in a plastic slide box at room temperature until use.","type":"ordered-list-item"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"ajpp3","text":"Gently cover with a cover slide, avoiding creating air bubbles.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dipcg","text":"Image on a fluorescence microscope under FITC blue excitation light (495 nm) with a 100x oil stage.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7dk68","text":"Aliquot   of each sample into a new 1.5 mL low protein binding nuclease free microcentrifuge tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":8,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"eiemn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"19","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1n84t","text":"Probe sonicate the samples in three   intervals with   between each interval at 50 Hz/40 amp while in an ice bath.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":36,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":53,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"afedl","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9rtlc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":10,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":0,"preset":[],"start":0}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":10,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"2":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"egoio","text":"Use a foam tube rack to keep the mouth of the tube out of the water. ","type":"ordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"e7gl2","text":"Make sure to use a probe sonicator with a microtip to ensure the probe fits in the tube and makes contact with the sample for the duration of the 10 second interval.","type":"ordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"30f06","text":"Clean the probe tip with 70% ethanol before and after each sample has been through the entire sonication cycle.","type":"ordered-list-item"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dqrru","text":"Add   EDTA to the sample with the tube on ice (  of   EDTA).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":47,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":52,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"0.1","error_concentration":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":28}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"4","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"2":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"0.5","error_concentration":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":28}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"39bam","text":"Incubate the samples   for   in the dark. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":21,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":27,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9ngp4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"","unit":165}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":900,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

warning: {"blocks":[{"key":"4d7n6","text":"Fixation with glutaraldehyde and chloroform treatment needs to be performed in a fume hood with a face shield and proper PPE. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"flat9","text":"Needles used to remove glutaraldehyde from serum vials need to be disposed of in a sharps container within the fume hood. Never replace the cap on a needle. Once the needle has been used, immediately deposit it into the sharps container.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
